fat_example.c File Reference

Detailed Description

FAT access example application.

This file gives an example of using the FAT access, through a shell.

  • Compiler: IAR EWAVR32 and GNU GCC for AVR32
  • Supported devices: All AVR32 devices can be used. The example is written for UC3 and EVK1100.
  • AppNote:

Author:
Atmel Corporation: http://www.atmel.com
Support and FAQ: http://support.atmel.no/

Definition in file fat_example.c.

static void fat_example_append_file ( void   )  [static]

Minimalist file editor to append char to a file.

Note:
Hit ^q to exit and save file.

Definition at line 442 of file fat_example.c.

References CR, file_putc(), LF, MSG_APPEND_WELCOME, QUIT_APPEND, and SHL_USART.

Referenced by main().

00443 {
00444   int usart_status;
00445   int c;
00446 
00447   print(SHL_USART, MSG_APPEND_WELCOME);
00448 
00449   // Wait for ^q to quit.
00450   while (TRUE)
00451   {
00452     // Get a valid char.
00453     if ((usart_status = usart_read_char(SHL_USART, &c)) == USART_RX_ERROR)
00454     {
00455       usart_reset_status(SHL_USART);
00456       usart_status = usart_read_char(SHL_USART, &c);
00457     }
00458 
00459     // If something new in the USART
00460     if (usart_status == USART_SUCCESS)
00461     {
00462       // if this is not the quit char
00463       if (c != QUIT_APPEND)
00464       {
00465         // Echo the char.
00466         print_char(SHL_USART, c);
00467         // Add it to the file.
00468         file_putc(c);
00469         // if it is a carriage return.
00470         if (c == CR)
00471         {
00472           // Echo line feed.
00473           print_char(SHL_USART, LF);
00474           // Add line feed to the file.
00475           file_putc(LF);
00476         }
00477       }
00478       // Quit char received.
00479       else
00480       {
00481         // Exit the append function.
00482         break;
00483       }
00484     }
00485   }
00486 }

static void fat_example_build_cmd ( void   )  [static]

Gets the full command line on RS232 input to be interpreted. The cmd_str variable is built with the user inputs.

Definition at line 384 of file fat_example.c.

References ABORT_CHAR, BKSPACE_CHAR, cmd_str, CR, fat_example_parse_cmd(), i_str, LF, MSG_PROMPT, and SHL_USART.

Referenced by main().

00385 {
00386   int usart_status;
00387   int c;
00388 
00389   // Get a valid char.
00390   if ((usart_status = usart_read_char(SHL_USART, &c)) == USART_RX_ERROR)
00391   {
00392     usart_reset_status(SHL_USART);
00393     usart_status = usart_read_char(SHL_USART, &c);
00394   }
00395 
00396   // if something new in the USART
00397   if (usart_status == USART_SUCCESS)
00398   {
00399     switch (c)
00400     {
00401     case CR:
00402       // Add LF.
00403       print_char(SHL_USART, LF);
00404       // Add NUL char.
00405       cmd_str[i_str] = '\0';
00406       // Decode the command.
00407       fat_example_parse_cmd();
00408       i_str = 0;
00409       break;
00410     // ^c abort cmd.
00411     case ABORT_CHAR:
00412       // Reset command length.
00413       i_str = 0;
00414       // Display prompt.
00415       print(SHL_USART, "\n" MSG_PROMPT);
00416       break;
00417     // Backspace.
00418     case BKSPACE_CHAR:
00419       if (i_str > 0)
00420       {
00421         // Replace last char.
00422         print(SHL_USART, "\b \b");
00423         // Decraese command length.
00424         i_str--;
00425       }
00426       break;
00427     default:
00428       // Echo.
00429       print_char(SHL_USART, c);
00430       // Append to cmd line.
00431       cmd_str[i_str++] = c;
00432       break;
00433     }
00434   }
00435 }

static void fat_example_parse_cmd ( void   )  [static]

Decodes full command line into command type and arguments.

This function allows to set the cmd_type variable to the command type decoded with its respective arguments par_str1 and par_str2.

Definition at line 271 of file fat_example.c.

References cmd, CMD_APPEND, CMD_CAT, CMD_CD, CMD_CP, CMD_DF, CMD_FAT, CMD_FORMAT, CMD_FORMAT32, CMD_GOTO_ID, CMD_HELP, CMD_LS, CMD_MKDIR, CMD_MOUNT, CMD_MV, CMD_NB_DRIVE, CMD_RM, CMD_SET_ID, cmd_str, CMD_TOUCH, cmd_type, i_str, MSG_ER_CMD_NOT_FOUND, MSG_PROMPT, par_str1, par_str2, SHL_USART, STR_A, STR_APPEND, STR_B, STR_C, STR_CAT, STR_CD, STR_CP, STR_D, STR_DF, STR_DISK, STR_FAT, STR_FORMAT, STR_FORMAT32, STR_GOTO, STR_HELP, STR_LS, STR_MARK, STR_MKDIR, STR_MOUNT, STR_MV, STR_RM, and STR_TOUCH.

00303     else if (!strcmp(cmd_str, STR_MV      )) cmd_type = CMD_MV;
00304     else if (!strcmp(cmd_str, STR_A       )) cmd_type = CMD_MOUNT, par_str1[0] = 'a', par_str1[1] = '\0';
00305     else if (!strcmp(cmd_str, STR_B       )) cmd_type = CMD_MOUNT, par_str1[0] = 'b', par_str1[1] = '\0';
00306     else if (!strcmp(cmd_str, STR_C       )) cmd_type = CMD_MOUNT, par_str1[0] = 'c', par_str1[1] = '\0';
00307     else if (!strcmp(cmd_str, STR_D       )) cmd_type = CMD_MOUNT, par_str1[0] = 'd', par_str1[1] = '\0';
00308     else if (!strcmp(cmd_str, STR_HELP    )) cmd_type = CMD_HELP;
00309     else if (!strcmp(cmd_str, STR_FORMAT  )) cmd_type = CMD_FORMAT;
00310     else if (!strcmp(cmd_str, STR_FORMAT32)) cmd_type = CMD_FORMAT32;
00311     else
00312     {
00313       // error : command not found
00314       print(SHL_USART, MSG_ER_CMD_NOT_FOUND);
00315       cmd = FALSE;
00316     }
00317     // restore last byte
00318     cmd_str[i] = j;
00319   }
00320   // if command isn't found, display prompt
00321   if (!cmd)
00322   {
00323     print(SHL_USART, MSG_PROMPT);
00324     return;
00325   }
00326 
00327   // Get first arg (if any).
00328   if (++i < i_str)
00329   {
00330     j = 0;
00331     // remove " if used
00332     if (cmd_str[i] == '"')
00333     {
00334       i++;
00335       for (; cmd_str[i] != '"' && i < i_str; i++, j++)
00336       {
00337         par_str1[j] = cmd_str[i];
00338       }
00339       i++;
00340     }
00341     // get the arg directly
00342     else
00343     {
00344       for(; cmd_str[i] != ' ' && i < i_str; i++, j++)
00345       {
00346         par_str1[j] = cmd_str[i];
00347       }
00348     }
00349     // null terminated arg
00350     par_str1[j] = '\0';
00351   }
00352 
00353   // Get second arg (if any).
00354   if (++i < i_str)
00355   {
00356     j = 0;
00357     // remove " if used
00358     if (cmd_str[i] == '"')
00359     {
00360       i++;
00361       for (; cmd_str[i] != '"' && i < i_str; i++, j++)
00362       {
00363         par_str2[j] = cmd_str[i];
00364       }
00365       i++;
00366     }
00367     // get the arg directly
00368     else
00369     {
00370       for (; cmd_str[i] != ' ' && i < i_str; i++, j++)
00371       {
00372         par_str2[j] = cmd_str[i];
00373       }
00374     }
00375     // null terminated arg
00376     par_str2[j] = '\0';
00377   }
00378 }

00808       // this is a "append"  command: Append a char to selected file.

00835       // this is a "mark" command
00836       case CMD_SET_ID:

00840       // this is a "goto" command
00841       case CMD_GOTO_ID:
00842         // set navigator to the marked index
00843         nav_gotoindex(&mark_index);
00844         break;
00845       // this is a "cp" command: Copy file to other location.
00846       case CMD_CP:
00847         // Try to set navigator on arg1 file.
00848         if (!nav_setcwd((FS_STRING)par_str1, TRUE, FALSE))
00849         {
00850           // Display error message.
00851           print(SHL_USART, MSG_ER_UNKNOWN_FILE);
00852         }
00853         else
00854         {
00855           // Get name of source to be used as same destination name.
00856           nav_file_name((FS_STRING)par_str1, MAX_FILE_PATH_LENGTH, FS_NAME_GET, TRUE);
00857           // Get file size.
00858           file_size = nav_file_lgtsector();
00859           // Mark source.
00860           nav_file_copy();
00861           // Save current source position.
00862           sav_index = nav_getindex();
00863           // Goto destination.
00864           nav_gotoindex(&mark_index);
00865           // Free space check.
00866           if (nav_partition_space() > file_size)
00867           {
00868             // Paste.
00869             nav_file_paste_start((FS_STRING)par_str1);
00870             // Restore previous nav position.
00871             nav_gotoindex(&sav_index);
00872             // Performs copy.
00873             while (nav_file_paste_state(FALSE) == COPY_BUSY);
00874           }
00875           // Restore previous nav position.
00876           nav_gotoindex(&sav_index);
00877         }
00878         break;
00879       // this is a "mv" command: Rename file.
00880       case CMD_MV:
00881         // Save current nav position.
00882         sav_index = nav_getindex();
00883         // Try to to set navigator on arg1 folder or file.
00884         if (!nav_setcwd((FS_STRING)par_str1, TRUE, FALSE))
00885         {
00886           // Display error message.
00887           print(SHL_USART, MSG_ER_UNKNOWN_FILE);
00888         }
00889         // Try to rename the file
00890         else if (!nav_file_rename((FS_STRING)par_str2))
00891         {
00892           // Display error message.
00893           print(SHL_USART, MSG_ER_MV);
00894         }
00895         // Restore nav position.
00896         nav_gotoindex(&sav_index);
00897         break;
00898       // this is a "df" command: Display free space information for all connected drives.
00899       case CMD_DF:
00900         // Save current nav position.
00901         sav_index = nav_getindex();
00902         // For all available drives :
00903         for (i = 0; i < nav_drive_nb(); i++)
00904         {
00905           // Select drive.
00906           nav_drive_set(i);
00907           // Try to mount.
00908           if (nav_partition_mount())
00909           {
00910             // Display memory name.
00911             print(SHL_USART, mem_name(i));
00912             // Display drive letter name.
00913             print(SHL_USART, " (");
00914             print_char(SHL_USART, 'A' + i);
00915             print(SHL_USART, ":) Free Space: ");
00916             // Display free space.
00917             print_ulong(SHL_USART, nav_partition_freespace() << FS_SHIFT_B_TO_SECTOR);
00918             print(SHL_USART, " Bytes / ");
00919             // Display available space.
00920             print_ulong(SHL_USART, nav_partition_space() << FS_SHIFT_B_TO_SECTOR);
00921             print(SHL_USART, " Bytes\n");
00922           }
00923         }
00924         // Restore nav position.
00925         nav_gotoindex(&sav_index);
00926         break;
00927       // this is a "format" command : Format disk.
00928       case CMD_FORMAT:
00929         // Get disk number.
00930         i = par_str1[0] - 'a';
00931         // if drive number isn't valid
00932         if (i >= nav_drive_nb())
00933         {
00934           // Display error message.
00935           print(SHL_USART, MSG_ER_DRIVE);
00936         }
00937         else
00938         {
00939           // Get the current drive in the navigator.
00940           j = nav_drive_get();
00941           // Select drive to format.
00942           nav_drive_set(i);
00943           // If format fails.
00944           if (!fat_format(FS_FORMAT_DEFAULT))
00945           {
00946             // Display error message.
00947             print(SHL_USART, MSG_ER_FORMAT);
00948             // Return to the previous.
00949             nav_drive_set(j);
00950           }
00951           // Format succeds, if drives is the one we were navigating on
00952           else if (i == j)
00953           {
00954             // Reset the navigators.
00955             nav_reset();
00956             // Set current drive.
00957             nav_drive_set(j);
00958             // If partition mounting fails.
00959             if (!nav_partition_mount())
00960             {
00961               // Display error message.
00962               print(SHL_USART, MSG_ER_MOUNT);
00963               // this will be the first "ls"
00964               first_ls = TRUE;
00965             }
00966             else
00967             {
00968               // this won't be the first "ls", system is already mounted
00969               first_ls = FALSE;
00970             }
00971           }
00972           // Format succeds, restore previous navigator drive.
00973           else nav_drive_set(j);
00974         }
00975         break;
00976       // this is a "format32" command: Format disk as FAT 32 if possible.
00977       case CMD_FORMAT32:
00978         // Get disk number.
00979         i = par_str1[0] - 'a';
00980         // if drive number isn't valid
00981         if (i >= nav_drive_nb())
00982         {
00983           // Display error message.
00984           print(SHL_USART, MSG_ER_DRIVE);
00985         }
00986         else
00987         {
00988           // Get the current drive in the navigator.
00989           j = nav_drive_get();
00990           // Select drive to format.
00991           nav_drive_set(i);
00992           // If format fails.
00993           if (!fat_format(FS_FORMAT_FAT32))
00994           {
00995             // Display error message.
00996             print(SHL_USART, MSG_ER_FORMAT);
00997             // Return to the previous.
00998             nav_drive_set(j);
00999           }
01000           // Format succeds, if drives is the one we were navigating on
01001           else if (i == j)
01002           {
01003             // Reset the navigators.
01004             nav_reset();
01005             // Set current drive.
01006             nav_drive_set(j);
01007             // If partition mounting fails.
01008             if (!nav_partition_mount())
01009             {
01010               // Display error message.
01011               print(SHL_USART, MSG_ER_MOUNT);
01012               // this will be the first "ls"
01013               first_ls = TRUE;
01014             }
01015             else
01016             {
01017               // this won't be the first "ls", system is already mounted
01018               first_ls = FALSE;
01019             }
01020           }
01021           // Format succeds, restore previous navigator drive.
01022           else nav_drive_set(j);
01023         }
01024         break;
01025       // Unknown command.
01026       default:
01027         // Display error message.
01028         print(SHL_USART, MSG_ER_CMD_NOT_FOUND);
01029         break;
01030       }
01031       // Reset vars.
01032       cmd_type = CMD_NONE;
01033       cmd = FALSE;
01034       // Display prompt.
01035       print(SHL_USART, MSG_PROMPT);
01036     }
01037   }
01038 }
